intro: Pedicularis macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Pedicularis macrocarpa typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils.
